document_title: Overactive bladder: Causes, symptoms, diagnosis and treatment
subsection_content:
According to Urology and Nephrology experts, to come up with a suitable treatment plan, doctors will take the following measures:
1. Ask about medical history
The patient will be asked about the symptoms they experience, how long they last, and how much they affect their life. Medical history will include questions about the patient's past and present health problems.; At the same time, patients should also bring a list of non-prescription and prescription medications they are taking. The doctor may also ask the patient about eating habits, fluid intake during the day and night...
2. Health examination
To find the cause of your symptoms, your doctor may also feel your abdomen and examine organs in the pelvis and rectum... using specialized instruments.; To assess the extent of abnormalities, the patient will be asked to keep a bladder diary for a few weeks to evaluate daily symptoms. Information includes: number of times to go to the toilet, time of urine leakage... to check: time and amount of fluid intake; number and duration of toilet visits; frequency of sense of urgency; time and extent of urine leakage...
3. Other testing methods
Urine test to look for signs of infection or blood; Cystogram to measure the amount of urine in the bladder after going to the toilet.; Other tests such as cystoscopy or urodynamics may also be ordered when the doctor needs a more in-depth examination.
